definition: to look for a job/to seek employment

sentences.english: Upon completing my graduate study, I will return to China and seek a job in a business firm.
sentences.chinese: 研究生学业完成后，我将返回中国，在企业谋职。

sentences.english: A few took jobs in government.
sentences.chinese: 少部分的人在政府中谋职。

sentences.english: A lack of qualifications can be a major obstacle to finding a job.
sentences.chinese: 学历不足可能成为谋职的主要障碍。

sentences.english: I'd like to take a job overseas, but there are too many things tying me down here.
sentences.chinese: 我想到国外谋职，但这儿有许多事情使我分不开身。

sentences.english: To everyone's surprise, I decided to seek employment in the financial sector.
sentences.chinese: 让大家感到吃惊的是，我决定在金融界谋职。

sentences.english: Why did you choose to come here for a job？
sentences.chinese: 你为何选定到此地来谋职？

sentences.english: International students are not allowed to take jobs.
sentences.chinese: 留学生在校期间不得私自谋职。

definition: to seek knowledge/to study/to attend college
to trade/to carry out commercial activities/in business
to hold an office or post
to seek one's livelihood/to work to support oneself/to earn a living
to accept a job offer/to apply for an advertised position
to seek help from social connections
to be transferred to another post/to post away
to plan matters/to look for a job
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
